result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Marie Kehren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lisa Marie Kehren is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lisa Marie Kehren was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2 and 15CF372.
Defendant to report to Probation today September 11, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF356.
Apply bond on DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

c: Def & Atty. eif

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF356 and 15CF372:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Lisa Marie Kehren appeared from jail. Case called at 11:50 a.m. Atty Andrea states there is a joint resolution and will be a plea on both files today. Plea questionnaire was not completed and will be done on the record. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY  to amended Ct 1 in 15CF356 and remove the enhancer. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine without the enhancer in 15CF356. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 15CF372 in it's entirety and Ct.2 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia dismissed in 15CF356. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes a statement. ADA McKinley requests 10 days to argue jail credit. Crt orders:

- S/W 2 years probation. 37 days conditional jail time if probation gets revoked. Sign up for probation by 4:00 p.m. today. Bond will continue until signs up for probation.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-  DNA Sample and Surcharge

- Court costs. If bond on file, will apply. If not, pay over the course of probation
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Appointing Atty Andrea. km
Results from baseline UA report by St Croix Co. Sheriff's Office
Justin Grobner  15R 011672. eif
filed by ADA Michael Nieskes. eif
Arraignment at 09-11-2015 11:30 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes and Megan Kelly. DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Lisa Marie Kehren appeared. Case called at 11:42 a.m. Atty Andrea states client willing to waive preliminary hearing. State filed information today. Set for arraignment. Court reviews defendant's charges and rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Crt finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial. Atty Andrea has received a copy of the information. No request to modify bond at this time. 10 days given to file a substitution of judge request.  Arraignment scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 08-06-2015 11:15 am

-Baseline test before release.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jennifer C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Report every Wednesday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Lisa Marie Kehren appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  ADA Nieskes requests $500.00 CB, Atty Andrea argues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 11:15 am.
signed by Judge R. Michael Waterman. eif
